profile.title: DANIELE QUINTILIANI
profile.description1: I'm a Full Stack Developer with {{age}} years and a passion that began when I was young with my Commodore64. Although my professional path led me to study Chemistry and Biology, I always kept my love for computers and video games alive.
profile.description2: In September 2023, I decided to change careers to pursue my true passion for programming. To refine my skills and learn industry best practices, I enrolled in an intensive Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp. During this program, I not only strengthened my proficiency in languages like JavaScript but also learned how to work on real-world projects, collaborate in teams, and utilize agile methodologies.
profile.description3: This change has been an exciting challenge and an opportunity to combine my scientific background with my new focus on software development. I'm determined to continue growing in this field and to bring my skills and passion to every project I undertake.
profile.description4: I hope you enjoy exploring my portfolio. Feel free to contact me for any projects or collaborations. I'm ready to take on new challenges and continue growing in this exciting world of programming.

qualifications.fullstackDescription: During the intensive Fullstack Web Development course at ISDI Coders, I acquired advanced skills in web development, specializing in both front-end and back-end technologies. I worked on real-world projects using modern technology stacks such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, Angular, Node.js, Express, NestJS, and PostgreSQL. This experience allowed me to develop a practical approach to programming, from user interface design to database management, with a focus on best practices and Agile methodologies. As the final part of the course, I presented a personal project, MotoMarket, which I had already started developing on my own.
qualifications.chemistryDescription: I completed the Vocational Training program in Chemistry and Biology at IPSIA E. Cavazza, where I acquired a strong foundation in chemical and biological sciences. During the course, I studied subjects such as organic and inorganic chemistry, microbiology, and laboratory techniques. I developed practical skills through laboratory experiments and research projects, which allowed me to gain a better understanding of the practical applications of science in industrial and environmental contexts.

certification.javaDescription: I completed an intensive course on Java EE (Enterprise Edition) at Core Network SL in Madrid. During the course, I gained advanced skills in developing enterprise applications using the Java EE framework. I studied and applied technologies such as Servlets, JSP (JavaServer Pages), EJB (Enterprise JavaBeans), and JPA (Java Persistence API), as well as software design and architecture techniques for scalable and maintainable applications. I worked on real-world projects that allowed me to integrate various components and services, enhancing my ability to manage and develop complex software solutions.

oracleCertification.name: Oracle Certified Java EE 7 Application Developer (1Z0-900)
oracleCertification.description: Achieved certification demonstrating proficiency in developing enterprise-level applications using Java EE 7. This includes expertise in JPA, EJB, Web Services, and the design and deployment of secure, scalable Java-based applications.

lamaCanyon.description: Developed the front-end using react, leveraging external libraries like Flowbite, ApexCharts, and JWT, among others. Built the back-end with Node (Express). Database hosted on MySQL via AWS RDS. The platform tracks incoming and outgoing money, provides gross and net profit estimates, and manages clients, orders, inventory items, and suppliers.

voltix.description: Developed the FrontEnd of a platform for Miluz sl. The platform was built using Angular 18 with Tailwind CSS, JWT, ApexCharts, Docker, Gitflow, and Python on the backend with a PostgreSQL database. I led the frontend team of six people, working remotely with a Scrum methodology.

motoMarket.description: Built an entire application using the NestJS framework for the back-end, implementing the database with PostgreSQL and Prisma as the ORM. Designed a user-friendly front-end with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and TypeScript, utilizing the latest version of Angular. Implemented unit, integration, and E2E testing. Used modern development tools like Git (Gitflow) and GitHub for version control and collaboration.

naf.description: Responsible for creating functional and intuitive applications and websites for clients using WordPress, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Angular for the front end. On the back end, worked with NodeJS, Java, REST API, and GraphQL, among others. All developed applications included testing support. Maintained and updated existing web applications to ensure security and performance.

MotoMarket.name: MotoMarket
MotoMarket.description: A social selling network for motorcycle enthusiasts. The idea was to have a platform where users can sell and buy motorcycles, parts, and accessories. The project was developed using Angular for the frontend, NodeJS with NestJS for the backend, and PostgreSQL for the database.

Pokedex.name: Pokedex
Pokedex.description: Using the PokeAPI, I created a Pokedex where users can search for their favorite Pokemon. The project was developed using Angular.

Voltix.name: Voltix
Voltix.description: Voltix is a pilot project for Miluz. The platform is designed to manage electricity bill costs using data from an electricity meter installed by the company and comparing it with invoices uploaded via PDF. If discrepancies are detected, it triggers an alert and generates a detailed report.

contact.modalThanks: Thanks for contacting me! I will reply soon!
